image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Why are thousands protesting for Māori rights in New Zealand?
item.description: Tens of thousands of protesters marched in New Zealand's capital on Tuesday, demanding the protection of Māori treaty rights. The demonstration was sparked by a proposed bill that critics say could undermine the Treaty of Waitangi, the country's founding document. Protesters say the bill, which aims to redefine the treaty's principles, could reverse decades of progress in recognizing Māori rights.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Paraguayan President Pena hospitalised during G20 summit
item.description: Paraguayan President Santiago Pena was hospitalized in Rio de Janeiro on Monday due to a "slight indisposition" while attending the G20 summit. He underwent medical checks at Samaritano Hospital, and his office is expected to release a report soon. Vice President Pedro Alliana confirmed speaking with Pena, stating he is doing well.

item.title: Chinese firm offers cash incentives to employees using internal app to date
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sydney trains set to shut down from November 21-22: All you need to know
item.description: Sydney's train network faces a complete shutdown from Thursday night to Sunday morning as rail workers commence a strike. The Rail Tram and Bus Union (RTBU) initiated the industrial action following unsuccessful negotiations with the New South Wales government regarding pay and conditions. The strike is expected to cause significant disruption for commuters, with limited alternative transport options available.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Scientists discover large underwater volcano off Alaska coast
item.description: Scientists aboard the Coast Guard Cutter Healy have discovered a large underwater volcano approximately 1,600 meters beneath the surface off the coast of Alaska. The team, including experts from NOAA, detected a potential gas plume rising from the volcanic formation. While the discovery is significant, experts believe the volcano poses no immediate threat to nearby ecosystems or human activities due to its considerable depth.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' campaign made large donations to interviewers before sit-downs: Report
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris' presidential campaign is under scrutiny for its spending practices. Federal records reveal substantial payments to organizations led by media figures like Rev Al Sharpton and Roland Martin, shortly before they interviewed Harris. These expenditures, along with costly celebrity-driven rallies, raise questions about the campaign's financial management.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Matt Gaetz paid for sex, says lawyer representing house witnesses
item.description: Two women testified that former Congressman Matt Gaetz paid them for sex, according to their lawyer. The women, who say they witnessed Gaetz engaging in sexual activity with a 17-year-old, testified before the House ethics committee investigating Gaetz. Gaetz resigned last week and has denied all allegations of sexual misconduct.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US' Texas board of education to vote on introducing Bible lessons in schools
item.description: The Texas State Board of Education is considering a proposal to allow public schools to use Bible lessons for students in kindergarten through fifth grade. The curriculum, optional for schools, has ignited debate, with critics arguing it promotes religious teachings and supporters viewing it as a way to provide a more comprehensive education rooted in traditional values.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump’s dance: The new victory anthem for athletes worldwide, watch video
item.description: Donald Trump's campaign trail dance moves have become a victory celebration for athletes across multiple sports. Jon Jones notably performed the dance after defeating Stipe Miocic for the UFC Heavyweight Championship, even presenting Trump with the belt. The trend, popularized in the NFL by Nick Bosa, has spread to college football and even reached British soccer.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Thousands rally in New Zealand against controversial Maori bill proposal
item.description: Thousands of protesters in New Zealand marched to Parliament in Wellington, opposing a bill that seeks to redefine the Treaty of Waitangi. Critics view the bill, introduced by the ACT Party, as an attempt to dismantle government support for the Maori population.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Where was Biden? The G-20 photo shows him out of the picture
item.description: The G20 'family photo' in Rio de Janeiro turned awkward when US President Joe Biden, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni were missing from the lineup. While a US official blamed logistical issues, the incident highlighted the lack of unity among world leaders at the summit.

item.title: 45 pro-democracy activists sentenced to prison in Hong Kong
item.description: A Hong Kong court has sentenced 45 pro-democracy activists to prison terms ranging from four to ten years under the city's national security law. The activists were found guilty of organizing an unofficial primary election in 2020. The court's ruling drew criticism from international observers, who called the trial politically motivated.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'No words exchanged, just attacked, viciously': 3 killed in 'random' stabbing incidents across New York city
item.description: A 51-year-old man was arrested in connection with three fatal stabbings that occurred in Manhattan on Monday. The victims, a construction worker, an elderly man fishing, and a woman near the UN headquarters, were seemingly attacked without provocation. The suspect, who may be homeless, was recently involved in other criminal cases.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Vibe is good': Elon Musk, Donald Trump and Robert F Kennedy Jr bond over McDonald's meal
item.description: Elon Musk dined with Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr, and RFK Jr on Trump Force One, enjoying a McDonald's meal. The gathering sparked online discussions, particularly regarding RFK Jr's choice of a cheeseburger and Coke, given his stance on healthy eating. The event highlighted the intersection of politics, fast food, and public perception.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vehicles collide outside Chinese school, leaving several children injured
item.description: Multiple children were injured Tuesday morning outside Yong'an Primary School in Changde, Hunan province, when a vehicle crashed into the school gate. Authorities are still investigating the number of casualties and the circumstances surrounding the crash. This incident follows a recent string of violent attacks targeting students in China, raising concerns about school safety nationwide.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
